title: Man Utd news: Solskjaer makes frank admission about 4-0 Chelsea win
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer had the perfect start to the season against Chelsea (Picture: Getty Images)

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits his team were flattered by their 4-0 win over Chelsea on the opening day of the Premier League season, ahead of their EFL Cup clash on Wednesday night.

The Red Devils enjoyed a dream start to their campaign, battering the Blues at Old Trafford through goals from Marcus Rashford (2), Anthony Martial and Daniel James.

Things have not gone so brilliantly since then for Solskjaer, while Chelsea manager Frank Lampard is enjoying a vast improvement in form.

United sit seventh in the Premier League table, seven points behind Chelsea in fourth, and Solskjaer admits that the thrashing in August was a false result.

‘I think Frank has done a good job because the performance against us was good. The result was bad,’ said the Red Devils manager.

Frank Lampard and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will meet again on Wednesday night (Picture: Getty Images)

‘We held our hands up as well and said: “4-0? Yeah, flattering”.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘We were pegged back, they pressed us, but we scored two goals, the second and the third within a minute which decided the game for us, so we didn’t think we were 4-0 better than them but it’s going to be an interesting game.’

United go to Stamford Bridge on Wednesday coming off an impressive draw with Liverpool and, most recently, a 3-1 win at Norwich on Sunday, re-establishing some momentum.

However, Solskjaer cannot compete with the momentum Lampard has gathered with the Blues, winning seven straight matches in all competitions, hammering Burnley 4-2 at Turf Moord on Saturday evening.

Lampard has earned praise for his use of young players such as Tammy Abraham, Mason Mount and Fikayo Tomori this season, a policy the Blues boss was determined to stick to despite the heavy loss on opening day in Manchester.

‘There is a lot of noise, win, lose or draw; selection, whatever 11 I pick,’ said Lampard.

‘With this big wide world of social media we have now it will be dissected and people will have different opinions and some people who are ex players or ex managers will have different opinions.

‘For me to have thrown that away after one game at Manchester United and a few opinions, that would have made me a bit of a flip-flopper.’

Chelsea host Man Utd at 8.05pm on Wednesday.
